Summary: Trigger periodic actions in MauiReactor using the built-in `Timer` widget integrated with MVU state.
Remarks: Use `Timer()` as a child node to raise `OnTick` at a given `Interval` (ms) when `.IsEnabled(true)`. Prefer this MauiReactor `Timer` over generic .NET timers for clean MVU integration and lifecycle safety. Typical usage: toggle a boolean state to start/stop, set `Interval` for cadence, and in `OnTick` update state (e.g., increment counters, schedule animations). Place `Timer` in your component tree near related UI; avoid long-running work in `OnTick` to keep UI responsive.
